result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthonio T Benson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -  Pay Restitution in the amount of $1,150 to Elijah J.  Restitution to be paid before costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Restitution to be paid during the term of extended supervision ordered as to Case# 16CF00451.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid after restitution has been satisfied.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid during the term of extended supervision ordered as to Case# 16CF00451.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge (if not already done so).
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts (at a rate to be determined by DOC) of prison funds.

Court sentenced defendant to serve  9  MONTHS  in the House of Correction with credit for  270 days; TIME SERVED.  
-  Court sets Restitution in the amount of $1,150
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $1,150 to Elijah J.  Restitution to be paid before costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Restitution to be paid during the term of extended supervision ordered as to Case# 16CF00451.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid after restitution has been satisfied.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid during the term of extended supervision ordered as to Case# 16CF00451.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge (if not already done so)
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts (at a rate to be determined by DOC) of prison funds.

Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
